title.rendered: Carlos Alcaraz became the youngest player in reaching top five position of the ATP’s world ranking since Rafael Nadal

content.rendered:
• The 19 years old Spanish Tennis Professional also became the youngest Grand Slam quarter-finalist since 1990 at US Open last year.

Carlos Alcaraz has grabbed all the attention of the ‘Tennis World’ while making a fresh record despite losing the Title of Hamburg European Open-2022 against Lorenzo Musetti. He became the youngest player in reaching top five position of the ATP’s World Ranking since Nadal on Monday. The 19 years old, Carlos lost the final battle of Hamburg this edition championship by 4-6, 78-66, 4-6 as Musetti, The Italian star lifted his maiden Grand Title.

          Earlier, Carlos, the Spanish tennis professional also became the youngest Grand Slam quarter-finalist since 1990 at US Open last year. In this order, He has also reserved third youngest masters 1000 champion record in Miami earlier this year.

          Rafael Nadal, the Spanish tennis star who had become the youngest ATP’s top five ranking player in 2005. Now Carlos has become the youngest player to reach top five in above ranking since him.

          According to Association of Tennis players (ATP),

Carlos joins the likes of Sampras, Chang and Agassi (three all former American Tennis Professionals) and becomes the youngest in top five since Rafael Nadal in 2005.

ATP shared a post on it’s official twitter handle, “This week Carlos Alcaraz reaches a career high of five in the World Peppersotne ATP Rankings.”

ATP officials said,

The 19 years old Spardian tennis star has made huge records as youngest age he has touched his country hood Nadal in very early tennis career

They added,

It assumes that he will grow very fast in future as he demonstrated in last few years and reserved the the youngest Grand Slam quarter-finalist since 1990 at US Open third youngest masters 1000 champion record in Miami

Brief Overview on Carlos Alcaraz:

  • Top 5 position of the ATP’s world ranking since Rafael Nadal in Hamburg European Open-2022  as the youngest Player
  • the youngest Grand Slam quarter-finalist since 1990 at US Open last year
  •  Third youngest masters 1000 champion record in Miami earlier this year.
  • Five ATP Tour Titles winner in men’s singles

Read more: IND vs WI 2nd ODI: Axar Patel stars as India defeat West Indies by 2 wickets, seal series 2-0
